title: Make header and footer logo navigate to the homepage

requirements.summary: Make the header logo area in PublicLayout navigate to the main homepage route (/) via client-side navigation, with accessible link semantics.
acceptanceCriteria: When the user clicks the header logo on any route (e.g., `/services`, `/contact`, `/hr/employees`), the app navigates to `/` using client-side navigation (no full page reload).
The logo click target is keyboard-accessible (focusable) and has appropriate accessible labeling (e.g., link/button semantics and/or aria-label).
Existing navigation behaviors remain unchanged (smooth-scroll section links, HR Dashboard button routing, mobile menu open/close behavior).

file_operations.description: Update the header logo/brand block to be a single keyboard-focusable client-side navigation element (e.g., TanStack Router Link) that routes to `/` from any route. Add appropriate accessible labeling (e.g., aria-label like "Go to home"). Ensure existing smooth-scroll nav link behavior, HR Dashboard navigation, and mobile menu open/close state handling remain unchanged.

requirements.summary: Make the footer logo/brand area in PublicLayout navigate to the main homepage route (/) via client-side navigation, matching the header behavior and accessibility.
acceptanceCriteria: When the user clicks the footer logo/brand area on any route, the app navigates to `/` using client-side navigation (no full page reload).
The footer logo/brand click target is keyboard-accessible (focusable) and has appropriate accessible labeling (e.g., link/button semantics and/or aria-label).

file_operations.description: Update the footer logo/brand block to match the header: wrap the logo + brand name in a client-side navigation element that routes to `/`, and ensure it is focusable with appropriate accessible labeling (e.g., aria-label like "Go to home"). Keep all existing footer content and link behaviors unchanged.
